shortdesc.ph: Starts an audio device loopback test.

section.p: This method tests whether the local audio capture device and playback device are working properly. After starting the test, the audio capture device records the local audio, and the audio playback device plays the captured audio. The SDK triggers two independent callbacks at the time interval set in this method, which reports the volume information of the capture device (uid = 0) and the volume information of the playback device (uid = 1) respectively.

li.ph: You can call this method either before or after joining a channel. Agora recommends starting and stoping the test either before or after joining the channel.
Ensure that you call this method before joining a channel.

ul.li: This method tests local audio devices and does not report the network conditions.

pd.p: The time interval (ms) at which the SDK triggers the callback. Agora recommends a setting greater than 200 ms. This value must not be less than 10 ms; otherwise, you can not receive the callback.
